title: Kentwell Hall Long Melford Circular Walk Route

images.title: Simon Huguet / Long Melford Green
images.caption: Long Melford Green. Looking across the green from near the Hospital of the Holy and Blessed Trinity.

images.title: Adrian Cable / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: 16th-century water conduit near the entrance to Melford Hall, Suffolk

images.title: Geoff Barber / Kentwell Hall
images.caption: Kentwell Hall. Kentwell Hall is a Tudor Manor House. "Tudor" weekends are often held when the staff and student enact all aspects of Tudor life, including using the language of the period.

images.title: Gill Edwards / Bridge at Kentwell Hall
images.caption: Bridge at Kentwell Hall

description: This circular walk explores the beautiful grounds of this 16th century stately home in Long Melford, Suffolk. There is much to explore including the lovely Walled Garden with Herb Garden, Potager and fruit trees. There are also moats with two original bridges, a Wildlife Pond, a Ha-Ha and woodland with Ancient Yews & Cedars. You can also stroll up the three quarter mile long avenue of ancient lime trees with the hall at the far end making a wonderful backdrop. The site includes a rare breed farm with Tamworth pigs, Bagot Goats and Poitou Donkeys. You can also tour the house with its grand rooms and furniture. Melford Hall is very close and is a good option if you would like to continue your walk. You could also pick up the long distance St Edmund Way and follow it east to the delightful village of Lavenham .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To extend your walking in Long Melford you could pick up the Sudbury Railway Walk and follow it south from Melford Country Park to Sudbury with its delightful water meadows. The flat, easy path is also suitable for cyclists.

display_address: Kentwell Hall avenue, Long Melford, Babergh, Suffolk, England, CO10 9DF, United Kingdom
